Low.name: Booger
Low.lore: A catch-all term for forest-dwelling creatures used to scare children; often described as hairy, mischievous, and elusive.

Low.name: Haint
Low.lore: Ghostly spirits that haunt homes and graveyards; traditionally repelled by “haint blue” paint on porches and windows.

Medium.name: Wampus Cat
Medium.lore: A six-legged feline guardian spirit or cursed woman; known for its stealth and eerie cries in the woods.

Medium.name: Not-Deer
Medium.lore: An uncanny deer-like entity with unnatural movements and human-like eyes; often seen near roads or trails.

Medium.name: Screaming Woman
Medium.lore: A ghostly female figure heard screaming in the woods; associated with tragic death and local hauntings.

Medium.name: Devil Dog of Valle Crucis
Medium.lore: A spectral canine with glowing eyes that chases travelers; often seen near bridges and graveyards.

High.name: Boo Hag
High.lore: A skinless witch that rides sleeping victims and drains their energy; repelled by salt and brooms.

High.name: Grunch
High.lore: Goat-like creature born of voodoo experiments; known for attacking pets and livestock in remote areas.

High.name: Whistler
High.lore: A whistling entity that mimics sounds to lure victims; often heard before disappearances or deaths.

High.name: Pope Lick Monster
High.lore: Goatman said to hypnotize or chase people onto train tracks; linked to multiple fatal encounters.

Low.name: Sinkhole Sam
Low.lore: Giant wormlike creature seen in a sinkhole lake; rarely aggressive, mostly elusive.

Low.name: Beast of Busco
Low.lore: Oversized snapping turtle spotted in Fulk Lake; considered more of a local curiosity than a threat.

Low.name: Specter Moose
Low.lore: A ghostly moose seen before disasters; often described as pale and oversized.

Low.name: Lady in White
Low.lore: Classic ghost of a woman who died tragically; often seen near roads or graveyards.

Medium.name: Loveland Frogman
Medium.lore: Humanoid frog with a wand-like device; sightings date back to the 1950s.

Medium.name: Hodag
Medium.lore: Horned creature with a spiked tail; said to be born from the ashes of cremated oxen.

Medium.name: Cohomo Monster
Medium.lore: River-dwelling creature with glowing eyes and foul odor; linked to livestock disappearances.

Medium.name: Green Clawed Beast
Medium.lore: Aquatic entity that attacked a swimmer in 1955; left claw marks and caused lasting trauma.

Medium.name: Enfield Horror
Medium.lore: Three-legged creature with glowing eyes and a hopping gait; caused panic in the 1970s.

Medium.name: Red-Eyed Entity
Medium.lore: Often seen in haunted woods or basements; associated with sleep paralysis and dread.

Low.name: Cactus Cat
Low.lore: Thorny feline that drinks cactus juice and howls at night; more mischievous than dangerous.

Low.name: Tommyknockers
Low.lore: Spirits that knock in mines to warn or trick miners; sometimes helpful, sometimes malicious.

Medium.name: Yucca Man
Medium.lore: Desert-dwelling ape-man seen near military bases; often described as silent and fast-moving.

Medium.name: Mogollon Monster
Medium.lore: Hairy humanoid with red eyes and foul odor; known for aggressive behavior and livestock attacks.

Medium.name: Slide-Rock Bolter
Medium.lore: Mountain creature that slides down slopes to devour tourists; said to be attracted to steep terrain.

Medium.name: Red Ghost
Medium.lore: Phantom camel with a rider’s skeleton; linked to violent encounters and ghost stories.

High.name: Skinwalker
High.lore: Witch who transforms into animals to harm others; feared for its ability to mimic voices and possess people.

High.name: Stikini
High.lore: Owl-witch that vomits its organs to hunt; associated with death and taboo rituals.

High.name: Hidebehind
High.lore: Creature that hides behind trees and snatches victims; never seen directly, always feared.

Low.name: Gumberoo
Low.lore: Bulletproof bear-like creature with rubbery skin; explodes when exposed to fire.

Low.name: Flannel Man
Low.lore: Red-plaid figure seen during sleep paralysis; often benign but unsettling.

Medium.name: Bigfoot
Medium.lore: Hairy bipedal creature seen in forests; elusive and rarely aggressive.

Medium.name: Dark Watchers
Medium.lore: Shadowy figures watching from mountain ridges; vanish when approached.

Medium.name: Shaver Lake Humanoid
Medium.lore: Tall, pale crawler seen near water; often linked to missing persons.

Medium.name: Colossal Clawed Beast
Medium.lore: Oversized bear with unnatural claws; blamed for deep forest maulings.

Medium.name: Devil’s Lake Monster
Medium.lore: Serpent-like creature seen in Devil’s Lake; known for dragging animals into the water.

Medium.name: Flatwoods Monster
Medium.lore: Alien-like entity with glowing eyes and spade-shaped head; linked to a 1952 sighting.

Medium.name: Vegetable Man
Medium.lore: Alien with syringe fingers that drains blood; described as plant-like and intelligent.

Medium.name: Pale Thing
Medium.lore: Emaciated humanoid with stretched limbs and no face; often seen crawling near homes.

Low.name: Manipogo
Low.lore: Serpentine lake creature akin to Nessie; rarely seen, never aggressive.

Low.name: Igopogo
Low.lore: Lake Simcoe’s serpentine inhabitant; known for brief sightings and sonar blips.

Low.name: Memegwesi
Low.lore: Small hairy humanoids that live near water; shy and rarely interact with humans.

Low.name: Old Yellow Top
Low.lore: Blond-haired Bigfoot variant; seen near mining towns, considered gentle.

Low.name: Ghost Moose
Low.lore: Spectral moose seen before disasters; often described as pale and oversized.

Medium.name: Devil of Dungarvon
Medium.lore: Screaming ghost of a murdered cook; haunts logging camps and riverside trails.

High.name: Waheela
High.lore: Giant wolf-like predator said to decapitate victims; linked to remote wilderness deaths.

High.name: Loup-Garou
High.lore: French-Canadian werewolf variant; cursed humans transform under moonlight and attack livestock.

High.name: Gougou
High.lore: Giant female monster said to eat entire villages; feared by early explorers and native tribes.

Medium.name: Ahuizotl
Medium.lore: Water-dwelling creature with a hand on its tail; drags victims into lakes and rivers.

High.name: Chupacabra
High.lore: Blood-draining creature blamed for livestock deaths; described as reptilian or canine.

High.name: La Lechuza
High.lore: Witch-owl hybrid that stalks at night; known for screeching and attacking travelers.

High.name: El Nahual
High.lore: Shapeshifting sorcerer who transforms into animals; feared for its magical and violent powers.

High.name: Tlahuelpuchi
High.lore: Vampire-like shapeshifter that preys on infants; said to be born into cursed families.
